EnglishExample.exItem: Examples of English embedded content questions include:
I know who hit the ball.
I know when she will come.
I know what the boy hit.

radioGroup.prompt: In embedded content questions, are there one or more special question marker particles or complementizers that may occur?
radioGroup.radio: Yes, and it is the same as the Yes/No question marker for embedded clauses (or both main and embedded clauses)
Yes, and it is the same as used in main clause content questions, even though it is different than the Yes/No question marker
Yes, but it is different from the one(s) used in main clause content questions and also different from the Yes/No question marker
No, it is a clitic which attaches to another word
Yes

radioGroup.prompt: Do the question markers occur in the same position(s) in embedded content questions as in embedded Yes/No questions?
radioGroup.radio: Yes
No, the positions are different or there are no Yes/No question markers in embedded clauses

radioGroup.prompt: Where does the question marker occur with respect to the rest of the question?
radioGroup.radio: Before
After
Either side

radioGroup.prompt: Can all the question markers appear on either side of the question?
radioGroup.radio: Yes, there is no restriction
No, there are separate sets for each side

radioGroup.prompt: Can the question markers appear on both sides in the question?
radioGroup.radio: No, only on one side or the other
Yes, and they must appear on both sides
Yes, they may appear on both sides, but only the one in initial position is required

radioGroup.prompt: May a different question marker also occur only in final position?
radioGroup.radio: No
Yes
Yes, they may appear on both sides, but only the one in final position is required

radioGroup.prompt: May a different question marker also occur only in initial position?
radioGroup.radio: No
Yes

radioGroup.prompt: Is a question marker required in every embedded content question?
radioGroup.radio: Yes
No, some content questions do not use/need the question marker
No, but an auxiliary is fronted

radioGroup.prompt: Is an auxiliary required to be fronted in every embedded content question?
radioGroup.radio: Yes
No, some embedded content questions do not require a fronted auxiliary

No, there is no marker or auxiliary fronting in embedded content questions, just fronting of an interrogative phrase and/or a difference in intonation or tone or other non-syntactic marking (this is like English)

form.instruction: You need to write a CC table pre-pass to separate it so that it stands alone and also make a root entry for this clitic in your lexicon. Give the entry the category C, or add the feature C to the feature line to change the category for the syntax. Also add the feature wh in either case. Mark the Yes/No question markers with the feature -wh. Add the feature -root to this entry.

In the lexicon, if this word does not already have the category C, add the feature C to the feature line to change the category for the syntax. Also add the feature wh in either case. Mark the Yes/No question markers with the feature -wh. Add the feature -root to this entry.

In the lexicon, mark those markers which can only occur initially with the feature CP-initial and those which can only occur finally with the feature CP-final. Do not enter either feature on any markers which can occur on either side.
